tweet: Every American should condemn the sick and violent attacks against Jewish families, communities and institutions. The freedom of religion is a basic right. We should stand united against hate.

While most of the focus was on impeachment, last week Congress approved the SECURE Act which will increase the employer tax credit from $500 to $5000 to help smaller companies offer retirement plans to their employees. One job should be enough.

Margaret and I and our family wish a safe and #MerryChristmas to all those celebrating today, we wish everyone good health, peace and joy! For those who struggle during the holiday season, you can call 800-273-8255 to speak to someone who can help you through this time.

While the press was focused on impeachment, last week Congress raised the age to purchase tobacco products to 21 years old and restored $1.5 billion in funding for state grants to combat the opioid epidemic.
My family and I wish a #HappyHanukkah to all who celebrate and a joyous 8 nights observing the festival of lights! pic.twitter.com/CeMPr0TAzS

Lost amidst all the reports on impeachment, last week Congress was able to repeal the Medical Device Tax that especially hurt the many of the world-class job-creating businesses in the Massachusetts biotech industry.

With the 2020 elections rapidly approaching it was a encouraging to see Congress approved $425M to strengthen our election security. 9 states do not yet have paper ballot backup systems -this funding will allow us to protect our democratic voting systems from foreign interference

While the impeachment vote took center stage, Congress actually managed to pass some important bills this week, including eliminating the so-called Cadillac Tax on Union Health Care Plans. I am delighted that we were able to see this anti-union tax fully repealed.

After quiet and studied consideration of the charges against the President, when called upon tonight, I will vote to support the Articles of Impeachment against President Trump, thereby referring them to the Senate for trial and possible removal.  My full statement is here: pic.twitter.com/BNdZXcmXCd

We will evaluate the threat of ISIS, Al-Qaeda and affiliated terrorist organizations throughout Africa and examine whether existing counterterrorism resources are being used effectively to achieve U.S. strategic objectives. Today I will be holding a @OversightDems National Security Subcommittee hearing on the growing threat of violent extremism to U.S. national security interests in Africa.   https://www.youtube.com/user/OversightDems …

I was very pleased to see H.R. 2500 also included a 3.1% pay increase for military families, as well as 12 weeks of paid parental leave for all federal employees, which has been a top priority for the House.
Last week the House passed H.R. 2500, the National Defense Authorization Act for FY 2020, which provides funding for a strong and smart national defense strategy.

"Dancing Block" is an entertaining music game and was described by the judges as having high quality visuals and exhibited great attention to detail.  Congratulations and well done team! You can view their app here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ajweJG2pYNk&feature=youtu.be …

I am pleased to announce the winner of the Congressional App Challenge for the 8th District of MA is an application titled "Dancing Block" created by a team comprised of Xinning Wang, Tianyi Chen, Clara Vargas Fenili and Julianna Vieira Fernandes from CATS Academy Boston.

After carefully considering the weight of the evidence and listening to witness depositions, I intend to support the Articles of Impeachment against President Trump soon to be offered before the House of Representatives.  My full statement here: pic.twitter.com/E8CmcPEORI

Sharing consumer information with foreign entities is not only a breach of American’s privacy but a threat to our national security.  You can read my letters to Google and Apple here:   https://lynch.house.gov/press-release/chairman-lynch-seeks-info-foreign-entities-accessing-us-mobile-application-data …

As Chairman of @OversightDems National Security Subcommittee, I contacted Google & Apple to investigate whether they require mobile app developers to disclose overseas affiliations in an effort to ensure US consumer data is protected from being exploited by foreign governments.

(3/3) .. and then we joined Belgium Prime Minister Sophie Wilmès, Speaker Nancy Pelosi, Bastogne Mayor Benoit Lutgen and U.S. Ambassador to Belgium Ronald Gidwitz to pay tribute to all the WWII heroes at the Veterans Recognition Ceremony. pic.twitter.com/K48BtLHR2R

(2/3) Great to see so many Massachusetts Battle of the Bulge veterans here! Sincere thanks to Andy Biggio and his volunteers who brought them over. We had the privilege to lay a wreath in the city of Bastogne to honor the sacrifice and bravery of our WWII Veterans... pic.twitter.com/QGdVPBcOE1

(1/3) A wonderful honor to be a part of the U.S. delegation to Bastogne, Belgium in honor of the 75th anniversary of the Battle of the Bulge, where over 500,000 U.S. soldiers fought alongside our European allies in World War II to defeat Nazi Germany. pic.twitter.com/4LGeyaDTX3

– all of whom would have the costs of their medications significantly lowered if #HR3 is signed into law. Read here to see how else you may stand to benefit from #LowerDrugCostsNow:  https://lynch.house.gov/press-release/rep-lynch-votes-decrease-prescription-drug-prices-house-passage-hr3 …

#HR3 will also make those lower drug prices transparent so private insurance companies can make the same prices available to their consumers. In my district alone there are 104,880 people enrolled in Medicare Part D plan and 588,253 people enrolled in private health insurance –

I am pleased to announce the House passed #HR3, the Elijah E. Cummings #LowerDrugCosts Now Act, which will help bring down the cost of prescription drugs for all Americans by allowing Medicare to negotiate directly with drug companies.

(2/2) This is a serious revelation with irrefutable evidence that warrants immediate attention from Congress. You can listen to our discussion here: https://www.wgbh.org/news/international-news/2019/12/10/rep-stephen-lynch-says-he-was-lied-to-by-us-personnel-about-war-in-afghanistan …

Many studies show that employee morale, productivity & retention are increased when paid family leave is available. Paid family leave will allow hard working Americans to take care of sick parents, children & their own medical needs w/o jeopardizing their jobs & economic security

Today @OversightDems held an important hearing on the need for comprehensive national paid family and medical leave. The United States is one of only two nations in the world that does not guarantee any form of paid leave.

We have seen several states enact voting discrimination practices in recent years and #HR4 will help prevent future voting suppression and ensure every American voter has full access to the ballot box.
Very proud to see the House pass #HR4 last week, the Voting Rights Advancement Act, which will help restore the voting rights of every American citizen.

This week the House passed the bipartisan TRACED Act to help #StopBadRobocalls. Nearly half of calls placed to cell phones this year will be scams & this bill requires every call be verified, allows the blocking of spam calls & empowers the FCC to protect Americans from scammers.

These awards were given to police officers that deserve recognition for their exceptional work and efforts to protect and serve their community. Congratulations to Officer Bates, Officer Stotik and the entire @CohassetPolice Department on this great honor. https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/justice-department-honors-law-enforcement-officers-and-deputies-third-annual-attorney-general …

I am proud to announce @CohassetPolice Officers Aaron Bates & Alexander Stotik received the Attorney General’s Award for Distinguished Service in Policing this week. The Office of Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS) distributed only 19 of these awards across the country.

Pleased to announce that the House passed H.R. 4803 this week, the Citizenship for Children of Military Members and Civil Servants Act, which will grant permanent U.S. citizenship to all children born to parents who are stationed abroad while serving their country.

Today the House passed the bipartisan H.R. 2534, the Insider Trading Prohibition Act, which would be the first bill to explicitly ban insider trading by creating a clear definition of what constitutes insider trading to better allow the SEC to prosecute those who break the law.
